body_html:
I just merged a change internally that will change the default again:

If there are more than 40 runs, everything is toggled off by default
If there are 40 or fewer, then everything is toggled on by default.

This way we avoid overloading the browser when there are lots of runs, but for simple cases (and new users) there is no added complexity. I got feedback that turning on only the first 10 was more confusing for everyone, since people mght not realize they are in an intermediate state.

@cancan101 I'm open to changing the constant from 40 to something lower if that would be better for you.

If there are 40 or fewer, then everything is toggled on by default.
This way we avoid overloading the browser when there are lots of runs, but for simple cases (and new users) there is no added complexity. I got feedback that turning on only the first 10 was more confusing for everyone, since people mght not realize they are in an intermediate state.
@cancan101  I'm open to changing the constant from 40 to something lower if that would be better for you.
body:
I just merged a change internally that will change the default again:

If there are more than 40 runs, everything is toggled off by default
If there are 40 or fewer, then everything is toggled on by default.

This way we avoid overloading the browser when there are lots of runs, but for simple cases (and new users) there is no added complexity. I got feedback that turning on only the first 10 was more confusing for everyone, since people mght not realize they are in an intermediate state.

@cancan101  I'm open to changing the constant from 40 to something lower if that would be better for you.
